alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 24 at 2:37PM AKDT until March 27 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SATURDAY TO 10 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys. * WHEN...From noon Saturday to 10 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility down to one quarter mile or less at times. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
